title: Homophones Challenge
description: Pick the correct homophone for each sentence â€” words that sound alike but have different meanings!

questions.question: ______ going to the store later today.
questions.explanation: 'They're' is a contraction of 'they are.' 'There' refers to a place, and 'their' shows possession.

questions.question: The dog wagged ______ tail happily.
questions.explanation: 'Its' is the possessive form. 'It's' is a contraction of 'it is.'

questions.question: She could hear the church ______ ringing in the distance.
questions.explanation: A 'bell' is a hollow metal instrument that rings. A 'belle' is a beautiful woman.

questions.question: I need to ______ a letter to my friend.
questions.explanation: 'Write' means to put words on paper. 'Right' means correct or a direction. 'Rite' is a ceremony.

questions.question: The baker needed more ______ to make the bread.
questions.explanation: 'Flour' is the powdery substance used in baking. 'Flower' is a plant blossom.

questions.question: The ______ of the country addressed the nation.
questions.explanation: 'Principal' means a person of authority or something of first importance. 'Principle' is a fundamental truth or rule.

questions.question: The hikers walked through the narrow mountain ______.
questions.explanation: A 'pass' is a narrow route through mountains. 'Past' refers to a time gone by.

questions.question: The new law will ______ many people in the community.
questions.explanation: 'Affect' is a verb meaning to influence. 'Effect' is usually a noun meaning result.

questions.question: Please ______ the package at the front desk.
questions.explanation: 'Accept' means to receive or agree to. 'Except' means excluding or apart from.

questions.question: The knight rode ______ the castle gates.
questions.explanation: 'Through' means moving in one side and out the other. 'Threw' is the past tense of 'throw.'

questions.question: The ship dropped its ______ in the harbor.
questions.explanation: 'Anchor' is the heavy device that holds a ship in place. 'Anker' is not a standard English word.

questions.question: She gave me a ______ of good advice.
questions.explanation: 'Piece' means a portion or part. 'Peace' means freedom from disturbance.

questions.question: The ______ on the stairs creaked under his weight.
questions.explanation: A 'stair' is a step. 'Stare' means to look fixedly at something.

questions.question: The doctor said the medicine would ______ her illness.
questions.explanation: 'Heal' means to make healthy again. 'Heel' is the back part of the foot.

questions.question: He tried to ______ his way through the crowd.
questions.explanation: 'Wade' means to walk through water or a difficult situation. 'Weighed' is the past tense of 'weigh.'
